Description: Incomplete dark brown, white, mixed brown and natural coloured, woven fragment of a goat hair bag or tent-cloth fragment, fabric type B. The spinning direction of the warp and weft is 'z' and the weave is plain and and warp-predominant. The thread count is 5 warp and 3 weft. The selvedge is plain with no paired warps. The threads are 2-ply goat hair. There is a central stripe 35mm wide made of mixed brown and natural hairs. It is bordered on each side by 4 brown warps, then by 2 warps of natural white colour, making a thin white line. This fragment was sewn to a piece of fabric type C.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.61, 65)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1. 145B (excavation object cat. no.)
